definitions.text: a shape that is spherical and small
examples: he studied the shapes of low-viscosity drops
beads of sweat on his forehead

definitions.text: a small indefinite quantity (especially of a liquid); ; ; ; --Kipling
examples: he had a drop too much to drink
a drop of each sample was analyzed
there is not a drop of pity in that man
years afterward, they would pay the blood-money, driblet by driblet

definitions.text: a sudden sharp decrease in some quantity
examples: a drop of 57 points on the Dow Jones index
there was a drop in pressure in the pulmonary artery
a dip in prices
when that became known the price of their stock went into free fall

definitions.text: a steep high face of rock
examples: he stood on a high cliff overlooking the town
a steep drop

definitions.text: a predetermined hiding place for the deposit and distribution of illicit goods (such as drugs or stolen property)
a free and rapid descent by the force of gravity
examples: it was a miracle that he survived the drop from that height

definitions.text: a curtain that can be lowered and raised onto a stage from the flies; often used as background scenery
a central depository where things can be left or picked up
the act of dropping something
examples: they expected the drop would be successful

definitions.text: let fall to the ground
examples: Don't drop the dishes

definitions.text: to fall vertically
examples: the bombs are dropping on enemy targets

definitions.text: go down in value
examples: Stock prices dropped

definitions.text: fall or descend to a lower place or level
examples: He sank to his knees

definitions.text: terminate an association with
examples: drop him from the Republican ticket

definitions.text: utter with seeming casualness; ; drop names"
examples: drop a hint

definitions.text: stop pursuing or acting
examples: drop a lawsuit
knock it off!

definitions.text: leave or unload
examples: unload the cargo
drop off the passengers at the hotel

definitions.text: cause to fall by or as if by delivering a blow
examples: strike down a tree
Lightning struck down the hikers

definitions.text: lose (a game)
examples: The Giants dropped 11 of their first 13

definitions.text: pay out
examples: spend money

definitions.text: lower the pitch of (musical notes)
hang freely
examples: the ornaments dangled from the tree
The light dropped from the ceiling

definitions.text: stop associating with
examples: They dropped her after she had a child out of wedlock

definitions.text: let or cause to fall in drops
examples: dribble oil into the mixture

definitions.text: get rid of
examples: he shed his image as a pushy boss
shed your clothes

definitions.text: take (a drug, especially LSD), by mouth
examples: She dropped acid when she was a teenager

definitions.text: omit (a letter or syllable) in speaking or writing
examples: New Englanders drop their post-vocalic r's

definitions.text: leave undone or leave out
examples: How could I miss that typo?
The workers on the conveyor belt miss one out of ten

definitions.text: change from one level to another
examples: She dropped into army jargon

definitions.text: fall or sink into a state of exhaustion or death
examples: shop til you drop

definitions.text: grow worse
examples: Her condition deteriorated
Conditions in the slums degenerated
The discussion devolved into a shouting match

definitions.text: give birth; used for animals
examples: The cow dropped her calf this morning
